answers.answer: I too suffered from Hydrosis for many years.  My physician prescribed Drysol.  You apply it like a deorderant at night before going to bed. (For me its 3 times a week) this will stop the sweating under your arms altogether.

I also sweat heavily under my left arm, and barely any sweat from under my right arm. I had an operation on the right side of my thorax to remove a benign anterior mediastinal teratoma before this problem occurred, and my dermatologist said that perhaps the operation (which may have severed the sympathetic nerves on my right side under my arm) resulted in my unilateral hyperhidrosis. My surgeon was consulted, and he said this was highly unlikely.I'm still seeing my doctor to go through a number of tests as she has never heard of this problem before.
Are you insulin dependent diabetic?  My husband sweats like crazy on the side he injects his insulin.  Just one of those odd little things.

I have no diabetes and no other known physical problems... this problem sprouted about 2 years ago (I had my operation 5 years ago), so I'm not sure what's going on exactly.I wish I knew if it was something to be concerned about or not, as this is a pretty embarrassing problem.

question: I have recentely started sweating heavily...while sitting still and not being heated....but the strange thing is that it is only under one arm.  I have even felt water dripping down my arm at times, while sitting at my desk in the air conditioned office.  The right armpit does not sweat only the left.  Should I be concerned?
title: excessive sweating under only 1 arm
